list.name: Changes
list.comment: Added script to download YouTube data for Odysee import, and made minor script updates.

component.selected: Shell Script.Download YouTube Playlist for Odysee Import

Cut Video Start To End Time

item.itemvalue: Shell Script.Batch Burn Subtitles From SRT
Shell Script.Batch Generate Speech From Text
Shell Script.Batch Merge Video And Audio
Shell Script.Batch Translate YouTube Video With TTS

task.summary: Corrected temporary directory reference that was incorrect
Added ReverseVideo.sh to create reversed video/audio
Added DownloadYouTubeVideo.sh script to automate downloading videos using yt-dlp
Updated workspace.xml to include new scripts
Change default path to user home directory for non-Mac dialogs
Renamed translation scripts to have similiar naming to make them easier to identify
Updated workspace.xml to include correct script references and uncheck "execute in terminal" so dialog command displays correctly for non-Mac systems.

Numerous corrections to prevent filenames that might cause scripts to break and an update to allow hypen to be passed to TranslateYouTubeTranscript.py from TranslateYouTubeTranscript.sh, since some video IDs have hyphens.
Updated audio volume selection to calculate max RMS for audio then compare to frame RMS, rather than use audioop.max since RMS is more like the ear hears audio.
Added del(engine) after runAndWait() to help cleanup after the execution. This appears to have fixed the issue with longer (30+ minute) speech to text conversions failing.
Updated Readme.md to indicate issue with spleeter on M1 causing issues with TTS if the spleeter environment is active when attempting to generate speech from text.
Changes to engine init so it's only initialized once and global engine references are maintained for all later calls

Miscellaneous script changes and addition of a few batch scripts to demonstrate recursively scanning to: burn subittiles, generate TTS, and merge video and audio files. these files can be modified to suite use needs and help in cases where another conversion might have been unsuccessful
Added condition to cancel if user input is canceled.
Added more extensive comments to each script to make easier for end-users to understand script usage.
Added script to convert folder of audio or video files to a specific new format, and output the translated files to a user specified output folder.
Added script to convert folder of audio or video files to a specific new format, and output the translated files to a user specified output folder.
Added script to plot audio frames

Updated VideoJumpcutter.py to include option for volume selection. The supported options are max (default) and rms, which will allow one method or the other for determining what the max and frame volume values are based on. For some videos, it might be desirable to use rms where high pitches like gun sounds might be better detected using max value instead.
Organized a few scripts into the "Batch" category. Also, separated TranslateYouTubeVideo.sh into two scripts, making one that does TTS and one that does not.
Fixed but in VideoJumpcutter.py preventing margin frames from being added after the highlighted frame. This was due to AddMarginFrames not knowing the video max frames value.

Added LBRYUploadVideo.sh to extract videos, descriptions, and thumbnails from YouTube (yt-dlp requied), and use the lbry_batch_uploader Python module to load into LBRY for populating Odysee with videos that aren't loaded with the YouTubeSync on Odysee. Also, added NormalizeAudio.sh, and updated GenerateSpeechFromText.py to allow three methods for handling long-spoken TTS (0=truncate, 1=speed up, or 2=skip TTS for that subtitle)
Added script to upload a folder for videos, thumbnails, and descriptions to LBRY
Added script to download YouTube data for Odysee import, and made minor script updates.

MESSAGE.value: Updated workspace.xml

Numerous corrections to prevent filenames that might cause scripts to break and an update to allow hypen to be passed to TranslateYouTubeTranscript.py from TranslateYouTubeTranscript.sh, since some video IDs have hyphens.
Minor script changes
Updated audio volume selection to calculate max RMS for audio then compare to frame RMS, rather than use audioop.max since RMS is more like the ear hears audio.
Added del(engine) after runAndWait() to help cleanup after the execution. This appears to have fixed the issue with longer (30+ minute) speech to text conversions failing.
Updated Readme.md to indicate issue with spleeter on M1 causing issues with TTS if the spleeter environment is active when attempting to generate speech from text.
Changes to engine init so it's only initialized once and global engine references are maintained for all later calls

Miscellaneous script changes and addition of a few batch scripts to demonstrate recursively scanning to: burn subittiles, generate TTS, and merge video and audio files. these files can be modified to suite use needs and help in cases where another conversion might have been unsuccessful
Updated script references in configuration
Added condition to cancel if user input is canceled.
Added more extensive comments to each script to make easier for end-users to understand script usage.
Updated readme
Added script to convert folder of audio or video files to a specific new format, and output the translated files to a user specified output folder.
Added script to plot audio frames

Updated VideoJumpcutter.py to include option for volume selection. The supported options are max (default) and rms, which will allow one method or the other for determining what the max and frame volume values are based on. For some videos, it might be desirable to use rms where high pitches like gun sounds might be better detected using max value instead.
Updated Readme.md features list
Updated scripts list in workspace.xml
Updated gitignore
Organized a few scripts into the "Batch" category. Also, separated TranslateYouTubeVideo.sh into two scripts, making one that does TTS and one that does not.
Fixed but in VideoJumpcutter.py preventing margin frames from being added after the highlighted frame. This was due to AddMarginFrames not knowing the video max frames value.

Added LBRYUploadVideo.sh to extract videos, descriptions, and thumbnails from YouTube (yt-dlp requied), and use the lbry_batch_uploader Python module to load into LBRY for populating Odysee with videos that aren't loaded with the YouTubeSync on Odysee. Also, added NormalizeAudio.sh, and updated GenerateSpeechFromText.py to allow three methods for handling long-spoken TTS (0=truncate, 1=speed up, or 2=skip TTS for that subtitle)
Added minimum version for lbry-batch-uploader
Added script to upload a folder for videos, thumbnails, and descriptions to LBRY
Minor updates
Added script to download YouTube data for Odysee import, and made minor script updates.
